duties_responsibilities.duty: Render highly professional and technical nursing care to assigned patients.
Provide direct and indirect patient care using the nursing process (assessment, planning, implementation, and evaluation).
Direct and supervise other assigned team members and collaborate with multidisciplinary team members to provide age/developmentally appropriate care in accordance with unit standards of care.
Build relationships to promote a collaborative environment.
Always look for ways to improve the patient experience.
Be engaged and eager to build a winning team.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an accredited school of professional nursing. BSN Preferred. Current Basic Life Support Certification. Current additional certifications as required by department-NRP and S.T.A.B.L.E. Current license to practice professional nursing in Texas or eligibility to do so. Work experience: Neonatal Level III/IV RN experience including Transport experience and high-risk delivery attendance required.
